Key Match Events: Tyler Herro scored 26 points on 25 shots.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. recorded a triple-double with 16 points, 12 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Keegan Murray hit back-to-back threes early in the third quarter.
Miami went on a 19-4 run in the third quarter.
Haywood Highsmith topped off a 31-18 quarter with a falling-away offensive board.
Keon Ellis hit back-to-back threes to bring Sacramento back within nine points.
Domantas Sabonis tied the game with free throws under a minute to go.
Terry Rozier hit a three-pointer in overtime to put Miami ahead.
Sabonis hit a three-pointer with under a minute to go in overtime.
Haywood Highsmith blocked Malik Monk's attempt in overtime.
Keon Ellis tied the game again by getting fouled and hitting one free throw.
DeMar DeRozan hit a sidestep jumper to go up three in the second overtime.
Sabonis' offensive rebound led to another DeRozan jumper to make it five points.
Post-Match Reflections: The lasting takeaway will be how difficult it was for the team to get Herro into his comfort spots as Sacramento continued the recent strategies of Atlanta and Utah by pressuring Herro with second defenders.
Drawing two to the ball is ultimately a gift that could unlock another level for Miami’s offense, but it takes a team to learn how to consistently take advantage of it.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Miami's zone defense caused significant struggles for Sacramento, especially without De’Aaron Fox.
Sacramento's offensive rebounding kept them alive, leading to 23 second-chance points.
